sen.j: 春宮坊（とうぐうぼう）は日本古代の律令制において存在した機関。
sen.e: Togubo existed in the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in ancient Japan.
Togubo existed in the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in ancient Japan.
Togubo existed in the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in ancient Japan.

sen.j: 春宮坊の職掌は皇太子の家政一般である。
sen.e: The official duty of togubo was to see domestic economy of the Crown Prince.
The official duty of Togubo was to see domestic economy of the Crown Prince.
The official duty of Togubo was to see domestic economy of the Crown Prince.

sen.j: この機関は唐における皇太子の家政機関春坊を模倣したものである。
sen.e: The institution imitated the domestic governing institution Shunbo of the Crown Prince in Tang Dynasty.
The institution imitated the domestic governing institution of the Crown Prince, Chunfang (the palace of the crown prince) in the Tang Dynasty.
sen.cmt: of the Crown Princeの位置を移動、Shunbo→日本語読みのためChungangとし補足追加、in the Tang Dynastyとしました。(参照: http://www.springerlink.com/content/236363176823475r/)
sen.e: The institution imitated the domestic governing institution of the Crown Prince, Chunfang (the palace of the crown prince) in the Tang Dynasty.

sen.j: 唐制では皇太子関係の諸機関は半ば独立して一つの朝廷を形作っていたことから､春宮坊も形式的には諸官庁から独立している。
sen.e: In the Tang Dynasty, each institution related with the Crown Prince was half independent and formed one Imperial Court and thus togubo was also independent from each authority in the form.
In the Tang Dynasty, each institution related with the Crown Prince was half independent and formed one Imperial Court and thus togubo was also independent from each authority in the form.
In the Tang Dynasty, each institution related with the Crown Prince was half independent and formed one Imperial Court and thus togubo was also independent from each authority in the form.

sen.j: ただし､実際は太政官の強い管理下におかれていた。
sen.e: However, in fact, it was put under the strong management of Daijokan (Grand Council of State).
However, in fact, it was put under the strong management of Daijokan (Grand Council of State).
However, in fact, it was put under the strong management of Daijokan (Grand Council of State).

sen.j: 皇太子の家政は実際には春宮坊管下の諸機関によって行われる。
sen.e: The domestic economy of the Crown Prince was, in fact, managed by each institution under togubo.
The domestic economy of the Crown Prince was, in fact, managed by each institution under Togubo.
The domestic economy of the Crown Prince was, in fact, managed by each institution under Togubo.

sen.j: 諸機関は以下の通り。
sen.e: Each institution is as follows.
Each institution is as follows.
Each institution is as follows.

sen.j: 主膳監
sen.e: Shuzengen (section of food).
Shuzengen (section of food).
Shuzengen (section of food).

sen.j: 主蔵監
sen.e: Shuzogen (section of clothing).
Shuzogen (section of clothing).
Shuzogen (section of clothing).

sen.j: 舎人監
sen.e: Tonerigen (the office of servants of the crown prince).
Tonerigen (the office of servants of the crown prince).
Tonerigen (the office of servants of the crown prince).

sen.j: 主馬署
sen.e: Shumejo (Stables Office).
Shumesho (Stables Office).
Shumesho (Stables Office).

sen.j: 主殿署
sen.e: Shudensho (Housekeeping Office).
Shudensho (Housekeeping Office).
Shudensho (Housekeeping Office).

sen.j: 主書署
sen.e: Shushojo (Documents and Medicine Office).
Shushosho (Documents and Medicine Office).
Shushosho (Documents and Medicine Office).

sen.j: 主兵署
sen.e: Shuheisho (Division in Charge of Military and Ceremonial Weapons).
Shuheisho (Division in Charge of Military and Ceremonial Weapons).
Shuheisho (Division in Charge of Military and Ceremonial Weapons).

sen.j: 主工署
sen.e: Shukosho (Division in Charge of Carpentry and Metal Work).
Shukosho (Division in Charge of Carpentry and Metal Work).
Shukosho (Division in Charge of Carpentry and Metal Work).

sen.j: 主漿署
sen.e: Shushosho (Division in Charge of Gluel and Drinking Water).
Shushosho (Division in Charge of Gluel and Drinking Water).
Shushosho (Division in Charge of Gluel and Drinking Water).

sen.j: 監・署は司の特殊形態である。
sen.e: Gen and sho were special forms of bureaus.
Gen and sho were special forms of bureaus.
Gen and sho were special forms of bureaus.

sen.j: のちには東宮蔵人・帯刀舎人なども置かれた。
sen.e: Later, Crown Prince's chamberlain, Tachihaki no toneri (guard of the Imperial Palace) and so on was put.
Later, Crown Prince's chamberlain, Tachihaki no toneri (guard of the Imperial Palace) and so on were put.
Later, Crown Prince's chamberlain, Tachihaki no toneri (guard of the Imperial Palace) and so on were put.

sen.j: 備考であるが､東宮傅・東宮学士とは直接的な関係はない。
sen.e: As a remark, they were not directly related to togu-no-fu (an official in charge of education of the Crown Prince) and Togugakushi (educator of the Princess).
As a remark, they were not directly related to Togu no fu (an official in charge of education of the Crown Prince) and Togugakushi (Teacher of the Classics of the Crown Prince).
sen.cmt: togu-no-gu→Togu no fuとし、Togugakushiの補足修正 (用語集参照)
sen.e: As a remark, they were not directly related to Togu no fu (an official in charge of education of the Crown Prince) and Togugakushi (Teacher of the Classics of the Crown Prince).

sen.j: 大夫（従四位下相当）一名
sen.e: Tayu (corresponding to Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade)) one member.
Daibu (Master) (corresponding to Jushiinoge [Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade]) one member.
sen.cmt: Tayu→Daibuに修正、補足追加、カッコ表記修正
sen.e: Daibu (Master) (corresponding to Jushiinoge [Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade]) one member.

sen.j: 亮（従五位下相当）一名
sen.e: Suke (an assistant secretary of an office) (corresponding to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)) one member.
Suke (Assistant Master) (corresponding to Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade]) one member.
sen.cmt: Sukeの補足修正、カッコ表記修正
sen.e: Suke (Assistant Master) (corresponding to Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade]) one member.

sen.j: 大進（従六位従六位相当）一名 少進（従六位従六位相当）二名
sen.e: Taijo (Senior Secretary) (corresponding to Jurokui (Junior Sixth Rank)) one member and Shojo (Junior Secretary) (corresponding to Jurokui (Junior Sixth Rank)) two members.
sen.cmt: 「従六位」が重複しており、一つ削除しました。
sen.e: Taijo (Senior Secretary) (corresponding to Jurokui [Junior Sixth Rank]) one member and Shojo (Junior Secretary) (corresponding to Jurokui [Junior Sixth Rank]) two members.
Taijo (Senior Secretary) (corresponding to Jurokui [Junior Sixth Rank]) one member and Shojo (Junior Secretary) (corresponding to Jurokui [Junior Sixth Rank]) two members.

sen.j: 大属（正八位下相当）一名 少属（従八位上相当）二名
sen.e: Daisakan (senior clerk) (corresponding to Jurokui and Shohachi-i (Senior Eighth Rank)) one member and Shosakan (Junior Clerk) (corresponding to Jurokui and Juhachii (Junior Eighth Rank)) two members.

Daisakan (Senior Clerk) (corresponding to Shohachiinoge [Senior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade]) one member and Shosakan (Junior Clerk) (corresponding to Juhachiinojo [Junior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade]) two members.
sen.cmt: senior clerkの頭文字を大文字に統一「従六位正八位」「従六位従八位」→リンク先の単語と混ざっているため、ウェブ記載の「正八位下」「従八位上」を転記・訳文を修正しました。
sen.e: Daisakan (Senior Clerk) (corresponding to Shohachiinoge [Senior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade]) one member and Shosakan (Junior Clerk) (corresponding to Juhachiinojo [Junior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade]) two members.

sen.j: 史生 平安時代に新設
sen.e: Shisho (a person doing miscellaneous duties about documents) newly established during Heian period.
Shisho (a person doing miscellaneous duties about documents) newly established during the Heian period.
Shisho (a person doing miscellaneous duties about documents) newly established during the Heian period.

sen.j: 坊掌 平安時代に新設
sen.e: Bosho (assistant officer) newly established during Heian period.
Bosho (assistant officer) newly established during the Heian period.
Bosho (assistant officer) newly established during the Heian period.

sen.j: 使部
sen.e: Shibe (low rank bureaucrats)
Shibu (low rank bureaucrats)
Shibu (low rank bureaucrats)

sen.j: 直丁
sen.e: Jikicho (factotum)
Jikicho (factotum)
Jikicho (factotum)
